elements.description: Distinct parts of a document or website

elements.summary: Structuring and categorizing captured information for context.

elements.summary: The Catalist product is broken down into 6 main stages - take from the OMNI-Mapping OMNI-Cycle methodology

elements.summary: Filtering, moderating, and securing access to ensure data quality.

elements.summary: Engaging with content and people directly in the platform.

elements.summary: Delivering results, automating processes, and externalizing value.

elements.summary: A variety of ways to explore and interact with objects: Map (geospatial data), Calendar (time-based objects), Thread (discussion-based view), Gallery of Cards (visual browsing), Page (detailed object view), Swipe (mobile-friendly navigation and simple review for matchmaking), graph (shows connections) and Multi-Day Agenda (timeline-style event tracking).

Easily filter by status to track progress, move things forward, and revisit items you meant to get back to—keeping everything organized and actionable.

Other times objects are suggested to be referenced in your space (you don't have the ability to delete it but you can remove the reference, or accept it).

elements.summary: An inline minimal post form pinned at the top of the page that can be toggled and with just a single input box and an add button allows quickly adding with pre-determined settings
elements.description:
# Quick Add Feature

Assign: Rob Hurwich
Status: In Progress
Priority: High 🔥
Task Type: Project
Date Created: September 19, 2025 12:37 PM
Done: No

### **open questions:**

- do we store the MetaImage value as the Cover Image, and thus download the actual image file into the Catalist database?
    - Right now storing only url
- Maybe we have the full add button always say + Object, or also say “Add to this List”. I hit a possible UX glitch when on the page, where someone might get the impression that they can only add the default object type to the list, even though there’s others available.  Like, in their mind they might be thinking, I can only add a “book?” or whatever is the default.
- Do we update the logic for calculating if it’s a url to be more robust using regex?
- We could change “Object” to be some other default?
- After you add something using the quick add, do we want the form to hide?  right now it’s still there after submit.
- ~~When do we hide or show the quick add?~~
    - ~~We always hide it by default, and then when you click it toggles it~~
    - ~~On the list popup it’s going to be shown only when you click the + button on a toggle~~

### **To-dos:**

[**Consistent user experience workflow across all “add” functionality”**](https://www.notion.so/Consistent-user-experience-workflow-across-all-add-functionality-287df36f0e4080e8b8e5e5fb66c76e46?pvs=21)

- [x]  Add toggle on Popup > List view tab to show/hide Quick Add inline form: + Add To List —> x Cancel Add
- [x]  Add a NEW button on the list page to toggle the quickadd
    - [x]  decide on thursday settings for hiding or showing which button
    - [x]  remove the setting to only show for admins after toggle works
- [ ]  feature parity and consistency with the list page and list tab in the popup
    - [x]  Add an +/X icon to the add button on the list page
    - [x]  Add full button to the list tab (copy the logic, and add the full button to here)
    - [x]  hide button on list tab when setting is hidden
- [x]  small UI Stuff: remove pink hover and clean up colors on the list tab to be simpler like below
    
    ![Screenshot 2025-10-07 at 3.43.34 PM.png](Quick%20Add%20Feature%20273df36f0e4080e88457ebe2911b0bcf/Screenshot_2025-10-07_at_3.43.34_PM.png)
    
- [x]  **Incorporate feedback from Steve & Wendy from October 7, 2025**
    - [x]  Default the appearance of quick add: Off
    - [x]  Make the data type more like buttons, the filters not
    - [x]  the filter selectors below the quick add
- [x]  Rob: get working in the list popup and make the add button a toggle
    - ~~will need to set up the default color property in the quick add element - is inherited from the list.~~
    - ~~right now background for list, is always white - so quick add property is going to be more static in the pop up~~
    - ~~will need to set up Properties on the Pop-Up, like we did on the list page, with some differences, like “this pop up’s color”~~
- [ ]  make sure the + and X icons in “add to this list” button work on both light and dark backgrounds (dynamic color variables)
- [ ]  Optimize for mobile - the filters section make as wide as possible
- [ ]  **Finalize visibility & functionality for different users**
    - [ ]  create
    - [ ]  to do: add javascript to show log in popup when user not logged in
    - [ ]  
- [ ]  Make the default object type to be “object” when the list default object type is empty. *on a list with no default data type let’s make sure when we create with quick add we default to a data type. Could be “Object” by default or if it’s a url we can make it a link as a starting point.*
- [ ]  create a new feature in the Features Space database for the quick add - make a new object in there - copy the format from other features
- [ ]  Features Parity - this is a separate task, located here - [**Consistent user experience workflow across all “add” functionality”**](https://www.notion.so/Consistent-user-experience-workflow-across-all-add-functionality-287df36f0e4080e8b8e5e5fb66c76e46?pvs=21)
- [x]  Note: filter vs add how we communicate that
    - [x]  right now we are using 20% opacity behind the buttons

### Completed To-do’s

- [x]  Get the “More Options” action/workflow working
- [x]  The selected data type “chip” on the quick add form needs to be passed to the new object add popup.
- [x]  need to make check on quick add button so there has to be something entered in the field before you can add.  Right now you can add a new blank object - approach - make the button not clickable when the input field is empty
- [x]  Make the Quick Add button hover - more prominent
- [x]  Color for the input box and dropdown and the button text right now - always white
- [x]  More options - look at the reusable element “object_more” element and search for workflow “JavaScript” to see examples of that.
- [x]  Document any additions or changes I made in the workflow onto the catalist toolbox Notion page.
- [x]  test the dropdown -
- [x]  Mobile version - add padding to the quick add form RE on the page

**Visibility & Functionality for different viewers**

right now access is based on who can see the button.  So we’ll want to keep that, but ***add in a redirect for non-logged in users or non-space editors***

- List Page:
    - Currently:
	   - Full add button - anyone
	   - Add quick button - anyone
    - Functionality
	   - currently restriction is based on button visibility, hidden for logged out, shown to logged in
- Popup List tab:
    - Currently:
	   - Logged out users - can see Quick Add button but not click
	   - Logged in users - can see and click Quick Add button, but List’s “add button choice” is not showing full add

---

### **Notes on feature parity in [this task](https://www.notion.so/Consistent-user-experience-workflow-across-all-add-functionality-287df36f0e4080e8b8e5e5fb66c76e46?pvs=21):**

- **UP NEXT:**
    - add this feature to Home, and Spaces.
    - then will propose where the objects go and review it together

---

Quick add workflow is NOT adding object to the list.  actually it’s because it’s not being added to the Space.  

More Options workflow IS ADDING the object to the list.

*note here that there are two different object creation workflows, the one native to the Quick Add reusable element, the other via the Add Object popup that gets data passed to it via the Toolbox Javascript plugin functionality.*

you can add something to a List from any space, but it might not add to the space by default.  

get t.  always want an object added to have a place where it “lives” - 

visbility of quick add on list page.  do we want to encourage quick add or full add?  

decide on when to show the quick add.  right now the quick add on the Page View only shows up when you’re an editor.  so there could be a setting for a user to change what shows up, quick or full add.  

### Revising the User’s Data Type edit sections:

Within the List Editor Popup: Clean up and revise the UI and wording of the data types in the List Editor - In Content tab, and especially in Display tab -  “Object types filter” description and field. Rob take a first go at a first draft of this wording

in other words, in a List, there is a difference between what data type the List object IS, vs the data types the List object ALLOWS.  The List Object could be multiple data types, like a List and a Calendar, but generally only one, or two.  But could have many data types allowed to be added in.  

---

In a **non-list Object and a List** there is

1. Data Types selector for what the object is

- Content reads:
    - Data Types  [* = Primary]

2. Object Type Primary dropdown (misspelled) 

*-feedback - the Object Type Primary list drop down is not sorted in alphabetical order, while all others in the editor are*

A **List Object** has, in addition to the above, the below settings in the “Display” tab of the List editor:

1. Object Types Filter (multiselect)

- Content reads:
    - When users click "Add Below", what object types should be available as options? *Click here to configure data types*
1. Default Data Type (dropdown)
- Content reads:
    - Select a default data type when + is clicked

*—note that these two lists of data types are the same, and are available by configuring the full Settings For Each Data Type*

-feedback - clicking “Click here to configure data types” when I’m in a List’s **Page view** does not display those settings, however it does when I”m in the **Main List View**.

-feedback - in a list on the live version (Cat List), I don’t see the default data type dropdown, but in test version I do.

***Notes on this:***

- Taxonomy
    - in Content tab, there is “Object Type” and “Data Types” but they mean the same thing.
    - In Display tab, there is “Object Types Filter” and “default data type” but it’s the same list of things.

Meanings as used presently:

1. Object Type - what this thing IS 
2. Data Type - what types objects are allowed in this List, what are applicable?  What’s the default, most applicable?

***what means what:***

Content tab - this is like:

- “Object type” is like, what kind of an object is this thing?  It’s a list and a calendar.  Or a list and a feedback listing.  *my question here is, does a list need multiple Object Types?  even if it’s a calendar, it’s always a list of events, and furthermore, there’s not even a “Calendar” data type.  Calendar is a view.  So maybe this object type editor goes away on a List editor, or it’s only ever allowed “List” on the list.*

***My suggestions:***

Right now for the user, the terms “Object Type” and “Data Type” are being used interchangeably, but in different contexts in different places.  From a user standpoint, if we’re calling each “thing” an Object, then I’d say the term should be “Object Type” across the board.  Because then calling them data types sounds like we’re referencing something different when we’re not.

Secondly, it seems like choosing what Object Type an Object is, is really in the realm of Objects other than Lists, i.e., an object could be a Solution and a Perspective and an Idea.  In the Object editor there isn’t an option to chose allowable data/object types which makes sense.

On the other hand, it seems like choosing what Object Types are allowable/available is in the realm of Lists.  But the need for the user to decide what Object Type a List is, isn’t necessary.  A List can just be a list of various Object Types.  

---

***FEEDBACK - Data Types full configurations settings***

*As I was looking at this area I made a few notes*

**Permission settings:**

in the Data Types full configuration settings, the “who can create this data type?” checkboxes can get a bit confusing.  Meaning, as an Editor (List manager) of the List, I would expect that any data type I check off as one I want included in the List would be available to select as an Object Type that people can click on to “add.”  But right now, I only have the list of of Object Types available to choose from that are marked available to Editors.  

What I would expect is there to be a kind of “cascading” permission set up, so that anything that Anyone could create, is also something a Member can create, and so on.  

And then as a user I would have access shown to me of what objects I’m able to add to the list based on my permission level.

Are there any edge cases where it would be desired for Anyone to be able to create a data type, but not a Member, or an Editor?

**Possible inconsistencies between live and test versions, and when editing a List in a Space or on My Home:**

Hmm… all that above was pertaining to the test version, in the Live version it doesn’t seem like anything I choose in the full configuration settings is sticking when setting a private list from my home page.  And, I have access in the Display settings tab to choose from all the data types options.

However, in the live version on a List in a Space, I am able to change the configuration data type settings.

what does ‘interaction’, ‘hide’, and ‘requests’ mean?

---

### **Colors**

Background of the entire element should be set to color background and add border roundness of 10

Besides buttons, Go through all fonts and make them the font color dynamically

For certain things like the data type polls, the background color will be different in the following states

- when it’s hovered - accent color bg:append 25 (makes it 25% opacity)
- When it’s the selected one - accept color Bg
- When it’s the prefilled default one and nothing is selected - accent color bg
- The order of these conditions matters. If hover is at the top it means that when it’s selected and you hover it won’t change (probably what we want)

The **Append** expression is simply adjusting opacity. So the hex value like #ABABAB is 100% opacity. If you append 50 it’s that color but 50% as bring. If you append 00 it will be invisible. If you append 99 it will be almost the same. So append only makes the color less visible.

![JPEG image.jpeg](Quick%20Add%20Feature%20273df36f0e4080e88457ebe2911b0bcf/JPEG_image.jpeg)

However, if the use case is to make a button or element MORE prominent on hover, then the approach here should be different.  In this case one option is to make the initial color an append, like it can start off where it’s append 85%, and then on hover make it normal, which will lighten it up.  

---

### **Title Logic:**

Add an Event to Space Name

Would be something like 

“Add a [data type’s singular] to [list title]”

the data type logic would be:

prefilled data is not empty: formatted as text: yes= prefilled data type singular, no = selected data type is not empty: formatted as text, yes = selected data type singular, no = “Object”

The easiest way to build dynamic titles in bubble is using formatted as text which works with yes/no logic

[argument that is true or not]: formatted as text:

If yes: something 

If no: something else 

---

## Rob notes on next to do items 9-20-2025

**“Smart Input” Field:**

Are you still thinking to do this one input field on the form for either URL or Title?  Because I’d imagine we’d have to add logic to ascertain what possible data types are valid to use based on what is in the input field, whether a URL or plain text. For example:

If: URL, show these data type options (link, resource, etc)

If: Plain Text, show these data type options (goals, ideas, feedback, etc)

**“Quick Add” button workflow:**

I started working on this, making a list of the Object Fields to be added.  I can share that with you if you like.  I looked at other element workflows of the same kind, like “Popup QuickAdd 1 Form” to try to get a sense of it.

My main question here is about adding to a particular Space, List, or My Library, whether we can do that by adding a field in the “Create a new object” workflow step, or if we need to use additional “Make changes to a” space or list steps?

Also here there is a question for me about the process for adding in the correct title/URL based on what’s in the input field.

**Preview feature:**

And the create an object workflow brings me to the Preview feature and how that works as far as pulling in Metadata, because I imagine we’ll want to add as much as we can for this Quick Add form.  I can look at other examples of this, but haven’t dug in yet.

**Dynamic color of font on the Data Type chips:**

This is something I can likely figure out, but adding it here because it’s on my list.  The font color in these chips is defaulting to white, and that doesn’t look good against the light background color in these chip selectors.

![Screenshot 2025-09-20 at 1.27.33 PM.png](Quick%20Add%20Feature%20273df36f0e4080e88457ebe2911b0bcf/Screenshot_2025-09-20_at_1.27.33_PM.png)

**“More Options” button workflow:**

This is a piece that I can get started working on, using the Javascript plugin, and see how far I get, and then let you know when I run into issues.

---

### List Popup “list” view

**logic that pulls in the data types for the filter on the “Sidebar Object Detailed” RE:**

Two possible searches for data types in the filter

1. simpler - use the list’s “child data types”

Pros
Simple

Cons
Filters show even if no objects in list
If objects in list have a different data type you can’t filter for it

1. repeat the search that gives you the list of objects
Then get the data type of all those objects and do unique elements

On the list page I’m doing a modified version of 1 where I also allow the user to update the list easily with some suggestion pills to quickly add new types

You can use copy with workflows to just get the entire group with data types in the page and then paste with data types

Lastly you’d need to update the repeating group to add the additional filter condition like data type is this popups data type filter

---

I see the issue - the data is being passed to the popup's custom states, but those custom states aren't being used to populate the actual input fields when the popup opens.

## **The Problem**

Right now the flow is:

1. Data gets passed to popup's custom states ✅
2. Popup opens ✅
3. Input fields are empty (not reading from custom states) ❌

## **The Solution: Set Default/Initial Values**

You need to set the **initial content** or **default values** of the input fields to read from the custom states.

**For each input field in the "Popup Add Object Custom" RE:**

**Title Input Field:**

- Initial content: `This element's MetaTitle` (the custom state)

**URL Input Field:**

- Initial content: `This element's MetaURL` (the custom state)

**MetaDescription Input Field:**

- Initial content: `This element's MetaDescription` (the custom state)

**MetaImage Input Field:**

- Initial content: `This element's MetaImage` (the custom state)

## **How This Works**

When the popup opens:

1. Custom states get populated with data from JavaScript
2. Input fields read their initial content from those custom states
3. Fields are pre-filled but still editable by the user
4. When user submits, it uses the (possibly edited) input field values

## **Alternative Approach**

If setting initial content doesn't work, you might need a "When popup is shown" workflow that explicitly sets the input values:

**Workflow: When Popup Add Object Custom is shown**

- Set input value: Title Input = This popup's MetaTitle custom state
- Set input value: URL Input = This popup's MetaURL custom state
- etc.

## Object Types Filter:

@Rob Hurwich let’s copy the list “Group Data Types” instead of from spaces. it’s much more similar to what we want because the selected type for the filter will work from a state, NOT a url parameter, since this is a popup that can be on any page we don’t want to use url parameters.

![Screenshot 2025-10-04 at 10.57.07 PM.png](Quick%20Add%20Feature%20273df36f0e4080e88457ebe2911b0bcf/Screenshot_2025-10-04_at_10.57.07_PM.png)

![Screenshot 2025-10-04 at 10.52.36 PM.png](Quick%20Add%20Feature%20273df36f0e4080e88457ebe2911b0bcf/Screenshot_2025-10-04_at_10.52.36_PM.png)

The other reason for this is the query for data types is DEAD SIMPLE. the current page object’s “Child Data Types”…. which for the popup is just the sidebar’s object’s “Child Data Types”

Let me know if this makes sense! it will be good practice copying and pasting and then updating the errors/broken links because it’ll be almost one to one in terms of functionality. anywhere that is current page will just be the popup’s object.
Let’s call the new state we create something like “List Object Type Filter”

Decision

- The list of possible filters for object types for a list is the list’s child object types, NOT what’s in the list
    - downside: you can’t filter by thing in the list
	   - decision: as an admin it’s one click to add a new object type if there’s at least one item in the list that isn’t already inside of the child object types field
    - upside: you have more control and if there’s one wierd thing in your list you don’t have to put a filter for it
- Adding new things and filtering existing things is pulling from the same setting
    - downside: sometimes there will be a filter with 0 things
	   - workaround:
		  - hide filters that have 0
		  - show no “type display” found label
			 - add a book
- Is there a way to order the list
    - order in terms of how many exists
    - reorder button - workflow would find all of the types, sort them by the number, and then re-add them in that order

Quick add feature

- a way to quickly add a new object to a list, with default privacy, data type,
- ability to put a url and a title in the same field and it will automatically recognize
- defaults the privacy of the object to the privacy of the list
- defaults to the primary object type but let’s you quickly swap object types
- more options let’s you prefill the metadata and overwrite it, as well as add more options

Default Not Shown

- add to this list
    - toggles the quick add
- default quick or default full

Setting for Add: [Quick Add, Full Add, None]

Defaults to quick add. 

quick add toggles. 

full add as it is now. 

none hide the add button entirely

Who can view the add button has it’s own privacy dropdown

Anyone can add given they see the button (based on settings of the list) and whether or not an object is

- staged for review
- adding automatically into the list

depends on settings

- full privacy permissions similar to spaces
- light touch
- collaborators?

elements.summary: Catalist provides a comprehensive platform for event organizers, attendees, and speakers to enhance engagement, knowledge retention, and networking before, during, and after a conference. Organizers can sell tickets, feature speakers, and showcase sponsors while enabling attendees to interact with session materials, take time-stamped notes, and participate in discussions. Attendees can bookmark sessions, add status tags, and personalize their knowledge base for future reference. Catalist also facilitates matchmaking and post-event connections, helping attendees discover relevant peers, speakers, and follow-up opportunities based on shared interests. Through integrations with tools like Airtable, YouTube, and Zoom, Catalist ensures that event content remains structured, searchable, and actionable, turning every conference into a lasting knowledge hub and professional network.
elements.label: Conference With Focus on Knowledge Management,  Engagement & Matchmaking
